alert.note: Alert for Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 23 at 10:17PM CDT until May 24 at 12:45AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central Oklahoma, northwest Oklahoma, southwest Oklahoma and western Oklahoma, including the following counties, in central Oklahoma, Canadian and Oklahoma. In northwest Oklahoma, Blaine. In southwest Oklahoma, Caddo. In western Oklahoma, Custer and Washita. * WHEN...Until 200 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Water over roadways. River or stream flows are elevated. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1016 PM CDT, doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.3 to 0.6 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oklahoma City, Edmond, Midwest City, Del City, El Reno, Weatherford, Yukon, Bethany, Warr Acres, The Village, Piedmont, Nichols Hills, Hinton, Geary, Okarche, Hydro, Binger, Calumet, Corn and Lookeba. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
